Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay Our first time to Florence and we were warmly welcomed and are already planning a return visit. Hotel very good and central to all the tourists spots.Leonardo was helpful by recommending a restaurant which we very much enjoyed.
Reviews.Author: Sas053

Reviews.Content: great area, pick your room       via faenza, hotel on left
Reviews.Author: wcfyrfytr

Reviews.Content: Great Great Hotel and Excellent Staff...Suggested! This is a recommended Hotel. It is nearby all the main attractions, the staff is superbe and very helpful. Leonardo, the owner, is simply a perfect guest and speaks many languages.Rooms are very clean and well furnished. We will stay there again when we return to Italy. Great value.Recommended.Frances and Dutch.
Reviews.Author: frances72

Reviews.Content: Great Budget Stay       The triple room
Reviews.Author: lapartier

Reviews.Content: great budget hotel within walking distance of sights. Quiet at night. Very large 4 bed room. Great breakfast for a budget hotel. No lift but on the first floor so not a major problem. Very congenial host. Close to station. Great value.
Reviews.Author: baa58

Reviews.Content: Good location and cheap too Hotel monica is about 5 mins from the train station and pretty easy to find. It is also about 10 mins away from the Dome.The room was average size for Europe and it was very clean. The bathroom was really tiny but clean.The owner was very nice and gave us a free map and showed us where to go.The breakfast was typical- jam, bread, coffee etcOverall good hotel and would stay there again :)
Reviews.Author: justpeachy21

Reviews.Content: A Find in Florence The Hotel Monica is an excellent value for a two star hotel in Florence. It is a short, easy walk from the main train station and only about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo. The rooms are pleasantly furnished. The breakfast is above average. The hotel has a nice terrace on which you can have breakfast or spend a late afternoon with a a glass of wine. The owner Leonardo is a welcoming and gracious host and speaks English very well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, well located , comfortable place to stay in Florence
Reviews.Author: Ipswichtraveller9

Reviews.Content: Hotel Monica is Delightful Just spent 5 nights at Hotel Monica in Florence prior to taking Carnival Freedom transatlantic Rome to Miami.My wife and I had a fantastic time taking SITA and Lazzi bus lines to Fiesole, etc. and trains to Lucca, Pistoia and Viareggio.Hotel Monica is only a few hundred yards from all of the major terminals.Leonardo was a wonderful host who speaks perfect English but was very kind and helpful with our faltering attempts at Italian. He also helped navigating the bus system and finding memorable local restaurants.Our room was large and spotless and hod a plesant view over a bougenvilla garden. Church bells from nearby church gave a delightful ambiance.Most memorable were the breakfasts that were included with the room. I have never had better capuccino, rich and creamy even though it was from an automatic machine. Fresh croissants, ham, cheese and assorted toppings and cereals were a great way to start our days. We fairly ran down the stairs to such reats. Al fresco dining on the terrace is available if weather permits.One moring at breakfast on the luxury cruise ship, my wife said You know what?What?I enjoyed Leonardo's more!Can't wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: Patt1

Reviews.Content: Great staff, convenient location I recently had a five night stay at the Hotel Monica while in Florence for a conference. I knew I would like the neighborhood, since twice before I have stayed in hotels on Via Faenza. The Hotel Monica has an excellent location--it's just a block around the corner to the Palazzo degli Affari conference center (and a laundry), and the main train station in Florence (Santa Maria Novella) is just beyond the conference center. There are many wonderful restaurants in the vicinity. The rooms are basic but adequate. The individually controlled air-conditioning is definitely Italian style--i.e., not very effective.The highlight of the visit, though, was the helpful staff. The hotel is located on the first and second floors (above the ground floor), but Leonardo was quick to help get my luggage to my room. He provided tips for restaurants with local cuisine and was able to efficiently summon taxis when needed. Best of all, when my previous hotel in Switzerland bungled sending a package so that it arrived in Florence more than a week after my departure, Leonardo kept the forwarding information on hand so it could be returned to my home in the US.For those who may have read previous reviews about the breakfast, I can report that they now serve fresh croissants and rolls which are promptly replenished, along with slices of of meat and cheese. And while the coffee is indeed from a machine, the Italians are experts at creating automated espresso and capuccino.
Reviews.Author: Travel4Science

Reviews.Content: cheap accomodation After having spent 5 excellent nights in the Monica Hotel, Florence, Tuscany, I would like to thank the Monica Hotel by writing a short review. The hotel is very nice and is located only 100 meters from the main railway station. Especially for globetrotters with huge backpacks, but also for people who want to go hiking in the tuscany mountains, the vicinity to the station is ideal. The latter is true especially since urban and SITA bus lines (the latter deserving villages in the surrounding of Florence) depart from the main train station and are thus easy to reach. Nonetheless, the hotel is not far from the city center (about 15 min walking). Several small shops, internet cafes and restaurants are in the direct surrounding of the hotel.The prices for rooms are reasonably to cheap, depending on season and load. We have spent 5 days at Monica hotels and negotiated 45鈧?per day in a two-bed room with shower and restrooms (breakfast included). I think this was a great deal!!!The people at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The staff speaks fluently English, however, is very kind if a guest tries to speak italian..... [--]
Reviews.Author: qbit
